page.title: 13Plastics Factory, Passfield.
page.content: Situated close to the River Wey, Auriol Plastics set up their factory in 1972, partly in the old brick building clearly dated 1857. It is a thriving industry making household and garden requisites,and involves coating metal with plastic. It offers valuable employment to 68 men and women,10 in modern office block alongside. This is almost certainly the site of Domesday Book corn mill, the iron 'hammer' from late 1500's to 1684, also the paper mill from 1684-1924. Paper for banknotes was made here, and the mill at work is remembered by local people. Descendants of the family who ran the paper mill until 1904 farm nearby. A small business employing 15-20 people supplies garden sheds and other portable timber buildings all made from sectional panels.
